column4: ubutnu keeps freezing for me on boot up... and will only boot up without freezing every 10th or so time... what can i do
Sounds like flaky hardware to me
is there a way i can scan my hard drive for defects?
badblocks... if it's that bad you'd probably see something in dmesg though
seek errors and drive status errors = bad times
dmesg?  i'm fairly new to linux, but i've been running ubuntu for 6+ months now this is just when the problem occured
run 'sudo dmesg'... it'll give you a log of recent system messages
i don't see any
That's good news for the drive
Usually if you have sporadic boot problems like that it's heat-related, and probably an issue with the proc
I see a lot of ones like this: [17179942.596000]  atkbd.c: Use 'setkeycodes e059 <keycode>' to make it known.
a wireless microsft keyboard
Also, are you getting any kind of weird graphical issues when it hangs on boot, or any kind of error messages?
That seems like sound reasoning to me
So it's not crashing or freezing once it boots?
actually it will freeze when after it boots too and it's kinda random, but it seems like every time I'm doing something with sound

Well, if it's not proc-related, my next guess would be RAM, but it could be a bad sound card as well (usually those won't cause the whole system to go down, but i've seen stranger things)... might wanna try pulling out the sound card and seeing if that resolves it
it's integrated :(
Hm... can you disable it in the bios?
yeah i can see if that helps... also on a side note if gnome freezes is the dmesg thing is where i should look for the error?
no problem
yeah thanks... i'll see what i can try to make this thing stop freezing
as far as I know... would be pretty silly if not, heh
